title: HPC Software Engineer
description: HPC is an important and technically challenging compute domain, with specialised tooling and a very high expectation of precision, efficiency and automation. This role is for a software engineer to join our HPC team to deliver an outstanding HPC experience - from bare metal to public cloud - as part of the broader Ubuntu platform. We are looking for a range of skills and experience, and will work on everything from the kernel to Debian packaging, but the heart of our effort will be Python software development for automation of key software in the HPC sphere. Our focus is on delivering a world class experience for the operation of the HPC cluster itself.You will be part of the team that delivers charms that deploy and manage the HPC cluster and provide HPC software packages.To succeed in this application you must be outstanding at maths and sciences, have built high quality software, have learned about open source ideally by working on it directly, and be looking for an engineering role with a company that makes mission-critical products for the global market. You should also be familiar with the open source environment, and want to build products in partnership with a community. Ideally, you should have some experience of high performance computing environments and a desire to unlock HPC for the world.For this role you must have experience with Python. Experience in HPC environments is a strong advantage. Familiarity with HPC hardware and software is also a strong advantage - delivering great experiences with Infiniband, RDMA, CUDA, MPI, Slurm, Lustre, Singularity and related technologies will be central to this team's work. It will also be advantageous to have experience with Docker image design and operations, and public cloud image design and operations.Location: This role will be based remotely in EMEA or the Americas regionsWhat your day will look likeWrite high quality, rigorously designed Python softwareCollaborate proactively with a globally distributed teamDebug issues and produce high quality code to fix themContribute to technical documentation that define best practices for authoring high quality operators Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutionsWhat we are looking for in youYou have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degreeYou have experience with writing modern, maintainable PythonYou love technology and working with brilliant peopleYou are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountableYou value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivatedYou have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Linux, Kubernetes, Public cloud, OpenStack, LXC/LXD, Python, Go, Debian packaging An exceptional academic track record from both high school and preferably university Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal eventsAdditional Skills That You Might Also BringExperience operating HPC clusters in productionExperiences with Infiniband, RDMA, CUDA, MPI, Slurm, Lustre, and/or SingularityWhat we offer youWe consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in personPersonal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per yearAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveMaternity and paternity leaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and othersPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company eventsAbout CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Software Engineer
description: Who we areJoin Embark on our mission to bring joy to dog lovers by offering the world’s best products and services to strengthen their bonds with the dogs in their lives. Our canine DNA test — named the best by The New York Times — enables us to make scientific advances in personalized pet care.Designed by world leaders in dog genetics (in partnership with Cornell University), the Embark Dog DNA Test provides information on genetic health risks and breed make-up, allowing dog owners, breeders, and veterinarians to drive personalized care plans based on a dog's unique genetic profile.Join our pack! At Embark, our People First culture is centered around building an amazing team and giving everyone an opportunity to have a voice and make an impact. We are looking for highly motivated and mission-driven employees who will join us as Embark leads the cutting edge of creativity and innovation in the fast-growing consumer genetics space.About the role:On the web engineering team, you will craft delightful digital experiences with Product Management and Product Design partners that span a full vertical slice, from UI to backend. Each Agile team consists of 4-5 engineers, a Product Manager, and a UX/UI designer. This year is a very exciting time to join Embark; this year the team will:Bring to life new and exciting business developments that make Embark the premiere destination for pet parentsElevate the delight and actionability of the platform for our highly rated DNA test productsDevelop engaging new features and systems that transform the way pet parents understand and care for their petsEvolve Embark’s architecture to enable Embark to continue to scaleOur Stack:React, MUI, HTML5, CSS3TypeScript, PythonNodeJS, GraphQL, Express, PostgreSQL, RedisAWS (ECS, RDS, ElastiCache Lambda, etc.)Our Tech Philosophy:We continually ship value to our customers and embrace CI and CD wherever possible. We deploy our stacks using CDK and GitHub Actions. We strive for a best-in-show customer experience. Observability is important to us. We leverage DataDog and Sentry and are active in detecting and resolving errors. We experiment with cutting edge tech to find new and innovative ways to enrich our products and services and the way we work. Recently we have been trying llama-index, AWS Bedrock, and AWS Q Business. We use critique jam sessions to collaboratively make new technology choices. What you’ll do:You are an Individual Contributor who is capable of consistently, reliably, and independently delivering well-defined solutions. You’ll utilize your strong understanding of software development and collaboration skills to maximize the impact of the code you and your teammates write. Here’s a closer look at the day to day:Deliver clean, efficient, maintainable code, as well as thorough tests and documentationPerform code reviews for others and respond to code reviews on your codeCollaborate with our Product and Design team and stakeholders to deliver high impact products and serviceContribute to improve our technology and development practices via retrospectives and other means, with the goal of continuous improvement of quality and team efficiencyEmbrace a continuous learning mindset – hone and develop your craft while learning cutting edge technologies in areas such as AIExperience we’re looking for:2+ years of professional web development experienceStrong experience in an area of web development (e.g. CSS, frontend frameworks, SQL databases, APIs, etc.)A foundational understanding of relational databases (PostgreSQL) using SQLA solid understanding of AWS or similar cloud technologiesExperience utilizing CI/CD tools like GitHub Actions or similarComfortable working with frontend frameworks like React, Angular, or VueWillingness to participate in on-call rotationExcellent verbal and written communication skillsEagerness to learn new technologies and solve problems Nice to have:Experience with customer-centric product developmentUnderstanding of DevOps and Agile development philosophiesWhy join the pack!At Embark, we might be dog lovers, but we’re passionate about people too. We’re committed to building an inclusive culture where all employees can belong and flourish. Here are some of our benefits and perks:A flexible vacation policy so you can take off the time you need when you need itPaid maternal and paternal leave (plus paw-ternity leave for new pets)Every other Friday off each summerPerks tailored for dog lovers including subsidized pet insuranceStartup perks with big-company benefits (401k match, a generous bonus structure, commuter benefits, top-of-the-line healthcare, HSA/FSA)Competitive salaries and equity participation — every employee gets stock optionsNew MacBook Pros or laptopsContinuing education, including attending conferences and company-provided resources to help with individual growth and developmentSalary: $116k - $170kEmbark is an equal opportunity workplace and values diversity at our company. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, sexual orientation, age, disability status, marital status, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by federal, state or local laws. See also EEO is the Law.

company: Global Technical Talent, an Inc. 5000 Company
title: Junior Full-Stack Developer
description: Title: Junior Full-Stack Developer Location: 100% remote - Oakville, ONPay Rate: CAD $35 - $45 / hrJob Description:Looking for a Full-Stack Developer to help build out core platform functionality, ensuring a smooth integration of frontend designs with backend data processing.This role is primarily frontend-focused (80%), working with our UX/UI designer to bring financial data to life through a simple, intuitive, and scalable interface. The remaining 20% will involve backend tasks, including integrating REST APIs and implementing basic database CRUD operations.You will be working alongside an existing developer to complete a project that was initiated by an offshore development team, collaborating closely with stakeholders and designers.This is a start up client that is an early-stage fintech company developing an AI-driven financial wellness platform to help employees manage their benefits and finances using real-time data from open banking and HRIS systems. They are currently at the Mini MVP phase, utilizing mock data for user testing while ensuring a strong focus on data privacy and security.This is an opportunity to join a greenfield project dealing with emerging fintech capabilities, where you'll gain Big Data and AI experience while working on a modern cloud architecture.Key ResponsibilitiesFrontend Development (80%)Implement Flutter-based UI designs to create an engaging and easy-to-use platform.Ensure a responsive and scalable UI across different devices.Collaborate with designers to refine user experiences based on feedback.Backend Development (20%)Add and modify RESTful APIs for data integration.Implement basic CRUD operations in PostgreSQL.Work with Spring Boot for backend enhancements.Collaboration & Agile DevelopmentWork closely with the design team to integrate frontend components with backend services.Partner with an existing developer to ensure code consistency and smooth project execution.Participate in code reviews and team discussions to enhance product quality.Required Skills & TechnologiesLanguages: Java, DartFrontend Framework: FlutterBackend Framework: Spring BootDatabase: PostgreSQLTools & Platforms: Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) is a plus but not required.Agile Development: Experience working in fast-paced startup environments or SaaS product development is highly desirable.About this opportunity:Impact: Build a product that helps employees take control of their financial future.Innovation: Work on cutting-edge fintech technology, leveraging AI, Big Data, and Open Banking.Growth Opportunity: Gain hands-on experience with modern cloud architecture and scalable SaaS development.Collaborative Environment: Work closely with designers, stakeholders, and developers in a supportive and agile setting.25-17692   #gttca
